org.yamcs.http.api

Class RestRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.yamcs.http.api.RestRequest

  • public class RestRequest
extends Object
    Encapsulates everything to do with one Rest Request. Object is gc-ed, when request ends.

      • hasBody

        public boolean hasBody()

      • bodyAsMessage

        public <T extends com.google.protobuf.Message.Builder> T bodyAsMessage(T builder)
                                                                throws BadRequestException
        Deserializes the incoming message extracted from the body. This does not care about what the HTTP method is. Any required checks should be done elsewhere.

        This method is only able to read JSON or Protobuf, the two auto-supported serialization mechanisms. If a certain operation needs to read anything else, it should check for that itself, and then use bodyAsInputStream().

        Throws:
        BadRequestException

      • bodyAsInputStream

        public InputStream bodyAsInputStream()

      • bodyAsBuf

        public io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf bodyAsBuf()

      • deriveSourceContentType

        public MediaType deriveSourceContentType()
        Returns:
        see HttpRequestHandler.getContentType(HttpRequest)

      • deriveTargetContentType

        public MediaType deriveTargetContentType()
        Derives an applicable content type for the output. This tries to match JSON or BINARY media types with the ACCEPT header, else it will revert to the (derived) source content type.
        Returns:
        the content type that will be used for the response message

      • deriveTargetContentType

        public static MediaType deriveTargetContentType(io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpRequest httpRequest)

      • getBaseURL

        public String getBaseURL()

      • getCompletableFuture

        public CompletableFuture<Void> getCompletableFuture()
        When the request is finished, the CompleteableFuture has to be used to signal the end.
        Returns:
        future to be used to signal the end of processing the request

      • getTransferredSize

        public long getTransferredSize()
        Get the number of bytes transferred as the result of the REST call. It should not include the http headers. Note that the number might be increased before the data is sent so it will be wrong if there was an error sending data.
        Returns:
        number of bytes transferred as part of the request

      • addTransferredSize

        public void addTransferredSize(long numBytes)
        add numBytes to the transferred size
        Parameters:
        numBytes -
